Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model
Updated schema version. LIDVID references updated to be LID references. Adding missing "investigation" references. Adding missing "agency" references. Description updated.

External_Reference.reference_text: Huck, F.O., and S.D. Wall, Image quality prediction: An aid to the Viking Lander imaging investigation on Mars, Applied Optics, 15, 1748-1766, 1976.
Huck, F.O., E.E. Burcher, E.J. Taylor, and S.D. Wall, Radiometric performance of the Viking Mars lander cameras, NASA Tech. Memo. TM X-72692, 1975.
Huck, F.O., H.F. McCall, W.R. Patterson, and G.R. Taylor, The Viking Mars lander camera, Space, Sci. Instr., 1, 189-241, 1975.
Mutch, T.A., A.B. Binder, F.O. Huck, E.C. Levinthal, E.C. Morris, C. Sagan, and A.T. Young, Imaging experiment: The Viking Lander, Icarus, 16, 92-110, 1972.
Patterson, W.R., F.O. Huck, S.D. Wall, and M.R. Wolf, Calibration and performance of the Viking Lander cameras, J. Geophys. Res., 82, 4391-4400, 1977.

Instrument.name: CAMERA 1
Instrument.description: The Viking Lander camera design was very different from vidicon framing or CCD array cameras. The lander camera was a facsimile camera with a single, stationary photosensor array (PSA) and azimuth and elevation scanning mechanisms. A lander image was generated by scanning the scene in two directions (azimuth and elevation) to focus light onto the photosensor array.
